PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mrs. Louise Chambers, of 237 Larimer Ave and Mrs. Faye Thomas of 7163 Vann Dr. were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 11, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe youngsters in their early teens, that is from 13 to 16 years of age, should be permitted to smoke cigarettes or drink alcoholic beverages?" Mrs. Louise Chambers' answer reads: "No, period. And the reason is because it tends to make them do things they wouldn't ordinarily do if they were not using alcoholic beverages."  Mrs. Faye Thomas' answer reads: "Definitely not because they are the future parents."
TitMainTitle: Louise Chambers and Faye Thomas standing on sidewalk near Wallace Paint Company, 6000 block of Penn Avenue, East Liberty
